examples: the wine left a dark stain

definitions.text: (microscopy) a dye or other coloring material that is used in microscopy to make structures visible
the state of being covered with unclean things
a symbol of disgrace or infamy; --Genesis
examples: And the Lord set a mark upon Cain

definitions.text: an act that brings discredit to the person who does it
examples: he made a huge blot on his copybook

definitions.text: color with a liquid dye or tint
examples: Stain this table a beautiful walnut color
people knew how to stain glass a beautiful blue in the middle ages
Red wine stains the table cloth

definitions.text: make dirty or spotty, as by exposure to air; also used metaphorically
examples: The silver was tarnished by the long exposure to the air
Her reputation was sullied after the affair with a married man
The laboratory worker dyed the specimen
